intro: Schoenefeldia nutans, commonly known as the nodding beauty, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to white flowers that droop downwards. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The genus Schoenefeldia is named in honor of the German botanist Johann Friedrich Schönerfeld.
